content.rendered:
Kedarnath Yatra

Location: Uttarakhand, India
Population: 612
Religion: Hinduism 100 %
Elevation: 3,553 m (11,657 ft)
Area: 2.75 Km2
Language: Hindi and Garhwali

Weather: 19° C - 1° C

Ideal Duration: 2-3 Days

Best Time: May-Jun

Nearest Airport: Dehradun

Kedarnath is a holy ancient place of Hindu worship where lord shiva is worshipped in the form of the king of the Kedar region. Located on the bank of the holy river of Mandakini this temple is a primal and a major pillar of the holy Char Dham Yatra along with Badrinath, Gangotri, and Yamunotri. Placed in the scenic district of Rudraprayag in the holy state of Devbhumi Uttarakhand, Kedarnath is famous for being the place which was built by the Pandava brothers making it incredibly pious to the devotees. Set against the majestic backdrop of the mighty snow-clad mountain range of Kedar dome, Kedarnath tourism depends entirely on the visit by the devotees.

A typical Kedarnath travel guide will start the journey from the holy city of Rishikesh and then after crossing all the Panch Prayag confluence points will reach Gauri Kund. From here on the adventure part of the spiritual journey begins which will entail a scenic and very challenging trek of 18 kms that will guide you up to the entrance of the temple. Every aspect of this journey is extremely memorable and very interesting comprising of memorable experiences and an overwhelming feeling of positivity. The journey is undertaken by domestic as well as international devotees looking to offer their darshan and prayer to the Lord at his holy abode.

The temple opens up for darshan only for a limited duration of around 6 months and for the rest of the year it remains covered in snowmaking approach to the temple inaccessible due to the hostile weather conditions.

The religious aspect of this place is unparalleled and involves some of the most prominent gods and historical figures. The temple was remade by the great saint, philosopher and the propagator for Advaita Vedanta Adi Shankaracharya during the 7th or 8th century.

Travelling to Kedarnath is an experience in itself and takes you across the various landscapes and through some of the most remarkable Himalayan beauty. Situated in the remotest location on the foothills of the Garhwal Himalayas the imposing mountain ranges and the lush green rolling valleys everything about visiting this place is truly one of a kind and cannot be experienced anywhere else in the world. Apart from Kedarnath Dham Temple, one can also go for some sightseeing visit to the nearby interesting sightseeing places that adorn the region in and around the Kedar region.

No matter where you go in Kedarnath be it spending some peaceful time meditating in the Kedarnath Gufa, offering your prayer to the Bhairav Devta shrine offering incredible views of the valley below, exploring the nearby holy towns of Agastyamuni, Sonprayag, etc. you will be fascinated and filled with immense love for nature and the higher power above. Travel with ease and utmost comfort to the holy abode of lord shiva. Experience religious spirituality like never before and take a trip up north. Take your family, friends or loved ones along and create a lifetime worth of memories.

About Kedarnath

The temple of Kedarnath Dham is situated in the district of Rudraprayag within the holy state or Devbhumi Uttarakhand. It is a known fact that Kedarnath forms a crucial pillar for the holy Chota Char Dham Yatra however it also makes for an important part of the Panch Kedar pilgrimage yatra. This is the highest jyotirlinga of lord shiva and its accessibility is very challenging due to its location in the remote part of India. Gracing the bank of the holy river of Mandakini, did you know that the real construction date of the temple is not known? This fact makes the reverence of this temple even more pious.

The legend and mythological account of the temple goes back to the era when the gods used to walk the earth during satyug. The temple is said to have been built by the Pandava brothers who following the advice of their priest, decided to make their way to the Garhwal Himalayas with an aim of asking for forgiveness from the lord for committing the crime of killing their kin. Everywhere they went they created temples and shrines dedicated to lord shiva asking for forgiveness for the crimes they had committed in the eyes of the supreme lord.

However later on, it was left abandoned for ages along with being a part of a 400-year long mini ice age that had covered the entire district of Rudraprayag. It was not until the 7th or 8th century that the prominent sage, seer, and philosopher Adi Shankaracharya had reached Kedarnath in an attempt to revive the feeling of oneness among the Hindu population,

that this temple was revamped and made the center of Hindu pilgrimage. Ever since then Kedarnath had always been attracting travelers, pilgrims and Shaiva devotees from across the globe.

Kedarnath Dham can be reached in several ways and the government keeps coming up ways to make the journey more convenient for them. From helicopter services to pony and palki services reaching the temple is not a big deal for many but sure is a challenging task for people deciding to reach by trekking since it involves a walking journey of 18 km one way. This is a very challenging experience where people brave the harsh weather conditions, difficult situations, stay in tents and bear a lot of hardship to offer their darshan to the lord above and attain their moksha or salvation.

Set against the incredible backdrop of the snowbound Kedar dome mountain ranges, the temple is an exhilarating experience that you won’t be able to easily forget. This overwhelming journey will take you across incredible landscapes, scenic views, deep plunging valleys, rolling lush hills and an omnipresent sense of spirituality that will keep you going. The temple opens for darshan for a limited duration of 6 months which commences from the holy eve of Basant Panchami. After remaining open for the said months the temple shuts down due to worsening weather conditions but the prominence of this place never subside.

Holiday Packages

The holiday packages for Kedarnath are available in a plethora of price ranges ranging from the pricey helicopter package to the pocket friendly road journey. The packages are designed to cater as many devotees as we can in order to enable them to have a memorable and spiritually evoking journey on the hills. Every package for Kedarnath is designed in such a way to make sure all your requests are met. You may even combine Badrinath or any other Dham Yatra with t making it a do dhamor even Teen Dham Yatra.

Things to Do

The spiritual aspect of Kedarnath cannot be denied and the primary reason for tourist visit here is the visit for the temple. However not only does this place attracts avid devotees but it also is a hub for adventure seekers, peace lovers, and mountaineers. There are numerous opportunities for them to explore the hidden jewels that dot this region. The Kedar Ghati is home to some of the most spectacular valleys and trekking routes which take you along scenic routes and majestic views. Nowadays avid bikers are also making their way to Kedarnath as a riding trip. Go to Kedarnath to find out more!
